Absolutely recommended. Everything Blue Shift Lacks at , Opposing Force Exceeds on it. It has a good lenght (5 to 6 hours) And a high challenge level. Contrasting with base HL, The difficulty never spikes, it's punishing by the end. but gradual. It doesn't spend time with explanations. My only criticism is that the ammount of weapons you get is never used to it's full potential, i think i only used the sniper rifle once, and only a handful of rockets, The game barely every puts you in situations where you need to attack from a long distance. Instead most enemies will always try to close distance to you . i also had more soft locks than the OG game, with me getting stuck in the wall between level transitions. Other than that, the game plays really well, has a good lenght that doesn't spend time with exposition more than necessary, And the best difficulty curve of the 3 games. Absolutely recommended. Be aware, this game expects you to play it well. because it's truly punishing.

Nachdem ich Black Mesa und Blue shift gespielt habe war ich natürlich auch an diesem spiel interessiert, um dem Bug beim Umschauen zu beheben braucht es nicht viel, einfach Raw Mouse Input einschalten und das Problem ist gelöst. Am anfang macht das ganze noch Spaß man möchte dem Black Mesa Vorfall aus der dritten Perspektive sehen, die level sind interessant und man erlebt wie alles sich entfaltet und was in anderen Bereichen passiert. Die Steuerung und das ganze Gameplay ist zwar Alt aber es geht noch gut von der Hand manchmal ist es einfach gewöhnungsbedürftig aber halb so wild.

In der Mitte des Spiels merk man leichte Ermüdungs Erscheinungen aber das ist ok soweit da man denkt gleich muss noch was kommen also der Höhepunkt zum Abschluss, leider wird man enttäuscht das Endgame ist voll von Gegnern zwar viel aushalten aber dafür dann auch viel schaden machen zum ausgleich kriegt man aber dann nur wenig Medkits und Aufladungen für seine Rüstung und nicht viel Munition für die entsprechenden Waffen mit denen das alles einfacher gehen würde.

Es ist sehr Frustrierend wenn viele starke Ausserirdische und Blackops Soldaten einem vor die linse geworfen werden und dann das halbe Arsenal wertlos ist da es nicht genug schaden macht. Dann hilft auch nicht die wertlose Schrotflinte für die ich absolut keinen Nutzen gefunden habe.

Was cool ist, ist das man seine Kameraden mitnehmen kann und so in der Theorie, Kampffähige Verbündete hat, oft sterben diese aber schnell und, wie ich gemerkt habe, sind die an engen Stellen nicht hilfreich und schießen in den Rücken weil vor dir ein Gegner ist, das macht es dann auch nicht einfacher. Nachdem ich (wie ich kurz später dann feststellte) kurz vor dem ende war, wo das spiel schon seit 2 Std wenig bis keinen Spaß mehr machte, dann Cheats aktivierte um das ganze endlich zu ende zu bringen, merkte ich es wäre nicht besser geworden. Der Endkampf war dann nicht wirklich gut.


Zum End Kampf:
[spoiler] Man hat vor sich ein riesiges Tentakelmonster, man soll die beiden Augen auf Augen höhe mit stionären  Laserwaffen beschießen damit dann die Mitte des Monsters aufgeht um dann dort schaden zu machen, das ganze dann 4 mal und fertig, zwischen durch werden dann die leider immernoch gleichen Gegner gespawnt was das ganze jetzt nicht besser macht.[/spoiler]

Dem spiel ist zu gute zu halten das es einige interessante Alien Waffen gibt die man nutzen darf, was aber trotzdem seltsam ist da man im Hauptspiel als Wissenschaftler nicht solch exotische Ausrüstung bekommt, man ist ein Marine der einfach weiß wie das ganze Funktioniert. (?!?!???)

Fazit: Lass da lieber die finger von, es fängt zwar gut an aber es wird sehr langweilig und eintönig zur zweiten hälfte.
A good but very hard and short experience, maybe too short and too hard for most people these days. I will recommend the game but make no mistake this is a hard game.

A condensed and concise Half-Life experience with new unique features. This expansion is more combat-oriented while still retaining most of the creative weapons in your arsenal. This allows you to still play Half-Life with a multitude of methods. The new weapons are incredibly fun to use, especially against the new enemies you face. The new mechanics like the squad control and displacer teleportation makes the game feel fresh and exciting while not separating it from the original game. The only bad thing I experienced was the rope climbing, but since it was used sparingly it didn't hinder the gameplay a lot. Overall I feel that this expansion is on par with the base game, definitely worth the time and money.

I had just finished playing Half-Life and heard about the two expansion packs Half-Life Opposing Force and Half-Life Blue Shift. I heard that Opposing Force was the better of the two and I was craving some more Half-Life action so I decided to get it and I have to regrets. Half-Life Opposing Force is a great addition to the Half-Life Universe. Following Corporal Shepard through his experience of the Black Mesa incident was great, new weapons, interesting new enemies and almost non-stop action! 

It is a lot shorter than Half-Life, but I still felt it was a full experience, in fact there were less boring parts and it seemed always on the move. If you do play, make sure to do the training first, its fun and the boot camp Drill Sergeants are just like the ones in Full Metal Jacket. The new enemies are interesting too and can provide a fun challenge. Times where you meet up with your squad add an interesting difference between this game and Half-Life. Although I had a lot of trouble at times with their path finding, most of the time they worked well. If they ever do an update or remake I hope the path-finding is reworked. Also you get to see moments from the original from a different point of view, not to mention more backstory and world building.  
Quick side note, it even has a multiplayer mode! Surprisingly there were still multiple community servers up and running with interesting multiplayer maps. I even found two servers that had 2 or 3 real players along with a few bots.

I would diffidently recommend playing this game if you want more of that Half-Life action!

Even as someone who normally thinks of DLC's as a pretty shady buissness practice, i cant deny that this is everything you could possibly want from a DLC. It has the same artstyle and setting as the base game, but with more content.
And i dont mean the boring type of filler content like:
"New player model (even though that is included unlike in BS), double barrel shotguns as opposed to to a single that you will never return to" .
 No I mean completely unique concepts for weapons that you dont see in other games (not even HL2).
Everything from a RPG that is basically a alien worm on your arm that you reload by feeding apples, or a barnacle that can be used as a grappling hook with its long sticky tounge. The game even features a sniper riffle for all you camper cowards out there.
It honestly feels like the type of creative and whacky concepts you'd expect to see in a Team Fortress game.
(and to this day its still a sin that Scout dont have the long jump module, or Spy have X-ray googles or a grappling hook)

Sinceramente é melhor do que Half-Life 1. Sim ele é BEM mais curto do que Half-Life mas ele é bem melhor pelos seguintes motivos.

1: Não tem nenhuma fase que se passa inteiramente em Xen.
2: Tem algumas armas a mais que são realmente boas.
3: Ele te da vontade de Jogar de novo, coisa que o 1° Half-Life não fez muito bem.

Mas ele fez uma coisa muito ruim em comparação, ele usa mais os ''Black Ops'' que sinceramente eu detesto eles, e também adicionou mais alguns inimigos muito fortes. (Inclusive um que se parece com ''Antlion Guard'')

Opposing Force as compared to Gearboxes second expansion Blue Shift is a much more complete experience. It's more comparable to a full game than a quick jaunt through Black Mesa; it's also a bit of a ball buster. They knew what they where doing and the pacing of health and power pickups and ammo replenishment is carefully planned to keep you on edge and fully clenched. Seriously that ending third is a straight ammo dump, fun and never really frustrating, but come on guys.

A bunch of surprising mechanics are introduced in this expansion like rope swinging which is insane to see implemented in 1999 and even though it's pretty jank it's cool to see. Add the hook shot like barnacle to the mix and you've got some of the earliest implementations of these mechanics in an FPS I can personally think of; props to Gearbox on that. The AI in this game specifically medics and engineers are used about twice and there not good but it doesn't bring down the experience. Other than those standouts the game is Half-Life and a fun time all around.

I was surprised at both the competence of this games set pieces and at the overall difficulty and aside from a few lulls, one of which being the final boss, and a couple of bugs this game is an absolute blast. You got me good Randy.

I love the addition of new weapons. Very satisfying.

质量精良的一部mod,遗憾的是依然没有中文字幕和语音。比起解谜更侧重于刚枪，解谜的部分偏向直来直去，基本上不会让人卡关，除了爬楼上绳子那里，走回头路是真的眼瞎没看见。ai队友依然是智障，连走路都不利索，还喜欢撞绊雷，不过他们的火力确实比较猛烈，还有医疗兵的大容量移动血包，都挺香的，即使在困难难度下也挺有用。关于游戏中后期难度过大以及弹药匮乏的问题，我个人是没啥感受的，可能与玩家个人的技术和采取的战术关系很大。
我自己在打困难难度的时候，中后期弹药都是严重过剩的，这还是没有使用传送枪嫖补给的情况下。说一下要点，首先把那个该死的自瞄关了，绝大多数情况下手动瞄准要比自瞄快多了准多了，除非是初入第一人称射击游戏的萌新。用机枪时绝对不要泼枪，能打死人就足够了，最好蹲下射击，后期常备一个弹夹。冲锋枪尽量留两发榴弹，总会用到的。激光绊雷是对付黑衣刺客的最佳武器，没遇到她们别乱用，困难难度下还会隐身，然并卵。关于后期出现的那个血特别厚的大虫子，直接用传送枪就能秒，有些地方还可以利用地形把他们卡住，用电击枪慢慢耗死。
